availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James R. W. Smith (Floyd County, Indiana, law student)

body.p: Floyd County, Indiana, student. Floyd County, Indiana, native. Son of Isaac P. Smith and Abbie H. Smith. Resident in Floyd County, Indiana, in 1850. Student in Floyd County in 1860. Student in Floyd County in 1863. Graduated from the Cincinnati School of Law in Cincinnati, Ohio, in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Indiana, Floyd County, New Albany, p. 326A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Indiana, Floyd County, New Albany Ward 2, p. 84-5.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Indiana, Floyd County, Ward 3, p. 329B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War) NARA RG 110, Floyd County, IN, June 1863, p. 427.
"Judge James R. W. Smith," Courier-Journal (Louisville, KY), May 29, 1913, p. 3.
"James Richard Wood Smith (1842-1913)," Find A Grave, Memorial 82218080, accessed January 31, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/82218080.
